title: How to Replace & Install Auto Carpet

steps.title: Take out the front car seats.
steps.content: Take out the front car seats. They are usually held in place by four bolts that you can see from under the car. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Remove the back seats.
steps.content: Remove the back seats. They may be held in place by fasteners at the bottom and brackets at the top. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Remove the seat belts, which should be held in place by bolts.
steps.content: Remove the seat belts, which should be held in place by bolts.

steps.title: Remove any other items that will be in the way.
steps.content: Remove any other items that will be in the way. This includes the trim and kick panels. Look for everything you can see or feel.

steps.title: Pull up the old carpet.
steps.content: Pull up the old carpet. Roll it up and be careful with it because you will use it to measure the new carpet. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Lay the old carpet on top of the new carpet as a template.
steps.content: Lay the old carpet on top of the new carpet as a template. Cut the new carpet just a little larger than the old one. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Start at the front and lay the carpet in the car.
steps.content: Start at the front and lay the carpet in the car. Trim around the edges and cut the holes as you go. The heel pad should be under the brakes and gas pedal. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Smooth the carpet from the center out.
steps.content: Smooth the carpet from the center out.

steps.title: Reinstall the seats and other items that you took out of the car.
steps.content: Reinstall the seats and other items that you took out of the car.

steps.title: Make sure everything is secure and you do not have any bolts left unused.
steps.content: Make sure everything is secure and you do not have any bolts left unused.
